Sentencas: Key features of hydrocarbon-fueled solid oxide fuel cell stack operation are elucidated by examining its local thermodynamic states with an aid of three-dimensional numerical simulations.
Titulo: Key characteristics of a hydrocarbon-fueled solid oxide fuel cell examined by local thermodynamic states

Sentencas: A high-fidelity physical model, which resolves the coupling between thermo-chemical reactions and heat and mass transport, is developed and validated.
Titulo: Key characteristics of a hydrocarbon-fueled solid oxide fuel cell examined by local thermodynamic states

Sentencas: To elucidate important reactions and transport phenomena, local thermodynamic state variables of hydrocarbon-fueled operation are compared with those estimated by assuming pure-hydrogen-supplied operation.
Titulo: Key characteristics of a hydrocarbon-fueled solid oxide fuel cell examined by local thermodynamic states

Sentencas: Results show that thermochemical reactions proceed at high rates through the thick anode support layer.
Titulo: Key characteristics of a hydrocarbon-fueled solid oxide fuel cell examined by local thermodynamic states

Sentencas: This induces complete methane conversion as soon as it is introduced to the anode and thermochemical reaction zones concentrated in the vicinity of the fuel inlet.
Titulo: Key characteristics of a hydrocarbon-fueled solid oxide fuel cell examined by local thermodynamic states

Sentencas: In spite of the fast reaction processes, hydrocarbon-fueled operation has the same electrical current density profile as pure-hydrogen-supplied operation, resulting from changing its local thermodynamic states.
Titulo: Key characteristics of a hydrocarbon-fueled solid oxide fuel cell examined by local thermodynamic states

Sentencas: Given that the presence of carbon substances and thermochemical reactions, in hydrocarbon-fueled operation, local chemical and electrical conditions are substantially different from those of pure-hydrogen-supplied operation.
Titulo: Key characteristics of a hydrocarbon-fueled solid oxide fuel cell examined by local thermodynamic states

Sentencas: A lower hydrogen concentration induces a higher concentration overpotential and decreases a reversible electrochemical potential.
Titulo: Key characteristics of a hydrocarbon-fueled solid oxide fuel cell examined by local thermodynamic states

Sentencas: A lower exchange current density is offset by increasing an activation overpotential at a given applied current.
Titulo: Key characteristics of a hydrocarbon-fueled solid oxide fuel cell examined by local thermodynamic states

Sentencas: All these reduce the overall cell voltage, as compared to pure-hydrogen-supplied operation.
Titulo: Key characteristics of a hydrocarbon-fueled solid oxide fuel cell examined by local thermodynamic states

Sentencas: Variation of transport properties such as diffusivities and viscosities influences heat and mass transport such that substantial stresses can be imposed on cell materials.
Titulo: Key characteristics of a hydrocarbon-fueled solid oxide fuel cell examined by local thermodynamic states

Sentencas: In addition, thermal conditions result in lower incoming-gas heating and a larger heat transfer rate to a neighboring repeating unit.
Titulo: Key characteristics of a hydrocarbon-fueled solid oxide fuel cell examined by local thermodynamic states

Sentencas: A larger temperature gradient near the fuel inlet may also impose stresses cell materials.
Titulo: Key characteristics of a hydrocarbon-fueled solid oxide fuel cell examined by local thermodynamic states

Sentencas: A lower power output, attributed to the electrochemical losses in a form of activation and concentration overpotentials, and materials degradation can be accompanied in hydrocarbon-fueled stack operation.
Titulo: Key characteristics of a hydrocarbon-fueled solid oxide fuel cell examined by local thermodynamic states
